notes:
1. Cost Estimation

Cost estimation is the process of predicting the cost of a project or product. Estimates are made at various stages of a project, with increasing levels of accuracy as more information becomes available.

2. Common Estimation Methods

  • Unit Method (Per Unit): The most common preliminary method. The total cost is estimated by multiplying the number of units by an average cost per unit based on historical data. (e.g., Cost = Square Footage Ã— Cost per Sq Ft).
  • Cost Indices: Used to adjust costs for changes in time (inflation) or location. A cost index is a dimensionless number that tracks the change in cost of a market basket of goods. $$ C_2 = C_1 \left( \frac{I_2}{I_1} \right) $$
    • $C_2$: Estimated cost at time/location 2.
    • $C_1$: Known cost at time/location 1.
    • $I_2, I_1$: Index values for time/location 2 and 1.
  • Power-Sizing Model (Capacity Factor): Used to estimate the cost of industrial equipment or plants based on a known cost of a similar item with a different capacity. $$ \frac{C_A}{C_B} = \left( \frac{S_A}{S_B} \right)^x $$
    • $C_A, C_B$: Cost of plant A and B.
    • $S_A, S_B$: Size (capacity) of plant A and B.
    • $x$: Power-sizing exponent (typically between 0.6 and 0.7, often called the 'six-tenths rule').

solvedExamples.question: A warehouse constructed in 2010 cost $500,000. The cost index in 2010 was 200, and the current cost index is 300. What is the estimated cost to build the same warehouse today?
solvedExamples.explanation: Use the cost index formula: $C_{current} = C_{past} (I_{current} / I_{past})$. $C_{current} = $500,000 (300 / 200) = $500,000 (1.5) = $750,000$.

solvedExamples.question: A 100-gallon tank costs $2,000. Estimate the cost of a 200-gallon tank using the power-sizing model with an exponent of x = 0.6.
